content.question: A semicircular loop with a clockwise current is placed in a uniform magnetic field that is directed into the page, as shown in the figure above. <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <msub> <mi>F</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D36@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is the net force on segment 1, the straight portion of the loop. <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <msub> <mi>F</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is the net force on segment 2, the curved portion of the loop. Which of the following correctly indicates the directions and relative magnitudes of the forces <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <msub> <mi>F</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D36@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <msub> <mi>F</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label:
Direction of<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <msub> <mi>F</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D36@</annotation> </semantics> </math>
 Direction of<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mover> <mrow> <msub> <mi>F</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math>
 Magnitudes

Toward the bottom of the page
 Toward the top of the page

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
